birthCohort.dldescription: Describes the season (spring/autumn) within the birth year into which animals are categorised. This is most likely derived or calculated from the birth date. As seasons vary around the world (including variations with 2, 4, 6, or 12 cohorts), a cohort number is used to interchange this data.

birthDate.dldescription: Date on which animal was born

birthDateConfidence.dldescription: 3 character string with positional characters representing Year Month Date (YMD). Values are A - accurate, E - estimate, U - unknown (value=A, E or U) e.g. AEU means Year Accurate, Month Estimated and Date Unknown

birthRank.dldescription: Describes number of progeny born to dam in a single birth event. Values are NULL, 1 if the animal is a singleton, 2 if it is one of twins, etc. Positive integer or NULL

birthYear.dldescription: Known as YearBorn in many systems. Derived from Birth Date where available.

breedAssessed.dldescription: Visual assessment of animal's primary or major breed. Known as 'Breed' in many systems.

breedDistributionDenominator.dldescription: Describes the basis for the proportion of each breed expressed in the breed distribution. Values: 16, 64, 100.

breeds.dldescription: A two-dimensional matrix of breed identifiers and the proportion of each breed in the animal (calculated from its parentï¿½s breed components). SIL currently uses percentages, and the NZ Dairy Databases use 16ths. We have also seen systems use 64ths. The breed name component of this attribute SHOULD reference the Animal Breed List values: http://www.farmdatastandards.org.nz/animal-breed-list/

breedSocSECode.dldescription: Breed Society Single Entry Code as used by the Breed Society

breedSocietyRegStatus.dldescription: Breed Society Registration Status. Valid values : Not Registered, Registered, NULL

exitFate.dldescription: Typically describes if the animal is Alive, Dead or in Transit. Also known as 'Status' in some systems. Reason for Fate should be captured as an observation

primaryBreedAbbreviation.dldescription: Abbreviation or short form of the primary breed e.g.'Rom' for Romney

rearingRank.dldescription: Rearing rank is used to indicate the number of progeny reared by the same dam during the same lactation as this has an influence on weights and growth rates. For example, an animal reared as a twin will have a rearing rank of 2. May be Null if unknown, or 0 if born dead

sex.dldescription: The gender or sex of the animal. This may be combined with current state information from the Animal schema to indicate the fertility status of the animal. Values: Male or Female. NULL  for unknowns

speciesBinomialName.dldescription: Binomial name of the species that combines Genus and Species. Genus is capitalised eg 'Bos taurus''

speciesCommonName.dldescription: Common term for species. Enumeration: Cattle, Deer, Goats, Sheep

survivedToWeaning.dldescription: Indicates whether the progeny survived to weaning (True,False).

visualColor.dldescription: Visually assessed colour of the animal

horned.dldescription: Current horned status for the animal.  Values include: Horned, Polled, Disbudded, Scurred.
